body:

https://misago-project.org/t/error-without-message-when-adding-numerous-small-jpegs-to-a-post/590/

When there's error with attachments during posting, the middleware will set it under the `attachments` key. However this key is not recognized by the client-side code, which results in empty snackbar being displayed instead.

title: Test ban's `registration_only` function behaviour

labels.name: backend
labels.description: This issue involves Python, Django or dependency (eg. database)

body:
It seems that current `registration_only` flag's behaviour on bans is mutually exclusive, ergo, `registration_only=True` bans are tested only during registration, and `registration_only=False` are tested outside of registration, where it should work like this:

- `registration_only=True` - ban is tested only during registration
- `registration_only=False` - ban is tested everywhere

Misago uses `request.path_info` instead of `request.path` in some places where this doesn't make sense, making deployments under path (eg. `http://somesite.com/misago/`) broken.

The worst offender here is `misago.admin` where our approach breaks redirects and authentication checks.

title: User permission "see category" generates 404 but should generate 403

labels.name: backend
labels.description: This issue involves Python, Django or dependency (eg. database)

body:
On [my misago instance](https://enfants-et-parents.net/), I configured `guests` with `See Only`  permissions on some categories, to be able to see these categories, but not their contents. This is done to make unregistered users get a glance of the website, without reading threads which are very private and must stay confidential.

On the "categories" page, the category name is clickable, and generates a 404 ([example](https://enfants-et-parents.net/c/parentage-bienveillant-et-inclusif/3/)) when clicked, for `guests`.

I think the 404 message is misleading (broken link, page deleted/moved) and gives a bad image of the website.

I'm questionning :

- should the link on the category be generated, given the fact that the user has no permission to see the contents ? No link on such category names seems fine to me. 

- whatever the answer to previous question, I think that a 403 is more appropriate. The 403 message would be "you have no permission to view this content", leading probably to a full message like "you have no permission to view this content. Please log in or register to display it."  Members and guests would better understand why the page is not viewable, and this could reinsurre them that the forum is really private.

Any thoughts ?

title: Misago sometimes crashing due repeated serialization of categories ACL

labels.name: backend
labels.description: This issue involves Python, Django or dependency (eg. database)

body:
There's recurring issue in Misago where users running Misago under Python 3k experience random crashes:

https://misago-project.org/t/api-error/376/
https://misago-project.org/t/debug-false-causes-server-error-500/463/

Those crashes seem to origin from Django Debug Toolbar building its own template context, running context processors, one of which seems to be Misago's context processor that serializes current `request.user` and its ACL's. Apparently this step occurs repeatedly, producing error on attepting to serialize already serialized data.

Its worth investigating if there's some edge case or gotcha involved in either Rest Framework's serializers or Debug Toolbar

title: Add bulk update/delete operations to API

labels.name: client
labels.description: This issue involves JavaScript, React.js and Node

labels.name: backend
labels.description: This issue involves Python, Django or dependency (eg. database)

body:
When user selects two or more posts on thread view and selects "delete posts" action, following error is occasionally raised:

```
OperationalError: deadlock detected
DETAIL:  Process 25972 waits for ShareLock on transaction 6914969; blocked by process 25973.
Process 25973 waits for ShareLock on transaction 6914968; blocked by process 25972.
HINT:  See server log for query details.
CONTEXT:  while updating tuple (9,44) in relation "misago_threads_thread"
```

This is likely to occur for posts move as well.

Upon some debugging I've came to conclusion that best way to go about this issue would be implementation of massmoderation endpoints for threads and posts.

**Bulk ops**

* [x] Bulk delete posts
* [x] Bulk delete threads
* [x] Bulk patch posts
* [x] Bulk patch threads
* [x] 404 on bulk request in endpoints that don't support those

**Locking**

Instead of locking other tables, we'll use `request.user.lock()` in critical endpoints (like/vote) to protect against flood by individual user and remove locking from other endpoints. We'll still wrap some ops in transactions to minimize risk of data corruption (eg. poll creation poll/post vote, thread move, delete).

title: Test that category deletion isn't corrupting categories tree.

milestone.title: 0.6 Alpha 1
milestone.description: First alpha release of Misago 0.6, bringing architectural changes, cleanup of codebase, JSON API and React.js-powered UI, offering minimal featureset but making solid foundation for future improvements and features.

body:
I've noticed (and hotfixed) today that handling of child categories of deleted category is invalid up in Misago.

In short, if user deletes category containing subcategories and decides that those should be moved under other category, category tree will be valid only for first of moved subcategories. This is because after calling `move_to` of first child, other children will be left with out of sync state of nodes three, and will need to be refetched from database before move.

This is bookkeeping issue for me to remember to write test asserting that it hotfix works.

title: users lists make lot of queries due to get_user_status() fetching user.online_tracker

labels.name: backend
labels.description: This issue involves Python, Django or dependency (eg. database)

body:
This is going to be massively tricky to fix in either `make_users_status_aware` or `get_user_status`, but luckily it occurs only in special case:

User account was registered, but never signed on (ergo, it was created via ACP or generated programmatically).

This can be fixed by creating tracker (and ban cache) together with user model in `create_user` (which is nice as its single point for fix).

It may also be good idea to add `populateonlinetracker` command that would create missing entries (if those were nonexistant or lost somehow).

body:
It seems that active users ranking generation gets costful real fast, and as such is not viable of doing on demand as user requests posters ranking without/stale cache.

As an alternative, this can be solved by including dedicated table storing current posters ranking, and cron task that would rebuild it on demand, at hours when forum traffic drops and hitting database with brutal GROUP_BY query is manageable.

title: Bug on ambiguous msgid of datesformats!
body:
Since Chinese has no concept about difference between singular and plural expression, I found two code snippets in `misago/utils/datesformats.py`.

``` python
#87-88
if diff.seconds < 3660:
            return _("Hour ago")

#103-106
            return ungettext(
                    "Hour ago",
                    "%(hours)s hours ago",
                hours) % {'hours': hours}
```

These two code snippets will generate just one **msgid** and **msgstr** pair.
Thus, there exist a potential problem on Chinese. 

``` python
#: .\utils\datesformats.py:87 .\utils\datesformats.py:103
#, python-format
msgid "Hour ago"
msgid_plural "%(hours)s hours ago"
msgstr[0] "%(hours)s小时前"
```

In Chinese, we use the same **msgstr[0]** to express it. That is to say, we need a keyword parameter but no one to the first function call (`return _("Hour ago")`).
So, it will to fail to translate the phrase "Hour ago".

title: Quote replies show as part of quote.

milestone.description: Bugfix release for 0.5.1 because some guys are already running Misago in production and 0.6 is months away.

body:
Hey Rafal,

Currently, you have to leave 2 newlines after the quote to have your message appear out of it. Some users seem confused, however, and remove the second newline to add their post.

Why isn't it set to only one newline after the quoted text? Usually line breaks (paragraphs) that aren't preceded by a quote sign (>) aren't considered quotes at all.

Example:

![reply1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6493679/1996936/2e171b46-851c-11e3-9c2c-5400e30469c0.png)
![reply2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6493679/1996937/2e3c1fae-851c-11e3-9be0-d7e6cb3dd813.png)
